conclusion: Analyze paths liquid will take from A, B, C, and D to containers E, F, or G.
Liquid flows from A downward.
Liquid encounters a black baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid flows horizontally and encounters a white baffle.
White baffle directs liquid downward.
Liquid continues downward and flows into container E.
Liquid flows from B downward.
Liquid encounters a brown baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid flows horizontally and encounters a purple baffle.
Purple baffle directs liquid downward.
Liquid continues downward and flows into container F.
Liquid flows from C downward.
Liquid encounters a blue baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid flows horizontally and encounters a yellow baffle.
Yellow baffle directs liquid downward.
Liquid continues downward and flows into container G.
Liquid flows from D downward.
Liquid encounters a gray baffle directing it to the right.
Liquid flows horizontally and encounters a blue baffle.
Blue baffle directs liquid downward.
Liquid continues downward and flows into container G.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid from B flows into container F.
Liquid from C flows into container G.
Liquid from D flows into container G.
